title: Are Ancient Macedonians linked to both Greeks and Albanians? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Are Ancient Macedonians linked to both Greeks and Albanians?” No, the ancient Macedonians are linked only to the Greeks, not to the Albanians (or to the modern Slavic people known as “North Macedonians”). Ancient Macedonians identified themselves as Greeks, whereas the Albanians were not present in antiquity, since they are first attested in history in the 11th century AD. “Now that these descendants of Perdiccas [i.e: the Macedonians] are Greeks, as they themselves say, I myself chance to know and will prove it in the later part of my history.” (Herodotus, “Histories”, 5.22.1) Furthermore, the Macedonians spoke Greek and shared the same religion, cults and customs, with the rest of the Greeks: “As members of the Greek race and speakers of the Greek language, the ancient Macedonians shared the ability to create political forms.” (N.G.L. Hammond, British scholar and expert on Macedon, “The Miracle that was Macedonia”, p.206) “When we take into account the political conditions, religion and morals of the Macedonians, our conviction is strengthened that they were a Greek race and akin to the Dorians. Having stayed behind in the extreme north, they were unable to participate in the progressive civilization of the tribes which went further south.” (Ulrich Wilcken, “Alexander the Great”, p. 22) “Nowadays historians generally agree that the ancient Macedonians form part of the Greek ethnos, hence they also shared in the common religions and cultural features of the Hellenic World.” (“The Oxford Classical Dictionary”, 3rd ed.- Macedonia, Cults, p. 905) “Modern scholars now almost unanimously recognise them [ancient Macedonians] as Greeks, a branch of the north-western and Dorian Greeks who after long residence in the Pindus region migrated eastward.” (John V A Fine, “The Ancient Greeks; a Critical History”, Belknap Press of Harvard University Press, p.605) Summing up, “We know the ancient Macedonians were fundamentally Greeks. That is to say they were Greek﻿ speakers and ethnically they were Greeks.” (Yale University, “Introduction to Ancient Greek History, Philip, Demosthenes and the Fall of the Polis”, 2007)

Ancient Macedonians could be as much linked to the modern Albanians as they could be linked to the Bulgarians, or their Slavic North Macedonian offsprings, the Romanians and many others living in the close vicinity of the Macedonian fatherland, within the borders of which there are Greeks living, though even further away, due to the mixing of the various peoples over time, especially after the Ancient Macedonian expansion, that's strictly according to a relatively weak genetic connection. However, there's no essential native cultural connection, like a linguistical one, between the Ancient Macedonians and either the modern Albanians or any of the other aforementioned peoples, except for the (modern) Greeks, who’re the only culturally connected to the Ancient Macedonians. It should be mentioned, though, that, from a historical perspective, the Albanians and the Romanians, unlike the Bulgarians, belong to some older cultural backgrounds to the Balkans, though far less old than that of the Greeks.

One theory is that Doric Greeks spent some time living alongside Celtic language speakers on the shores of the river Danube before migrating south into Greece. But this only is one theory.
